results.title: The Global Economy
results.creator_credit: Monash University, Open Learning Agency of Australia and ABC-TV (Australia)
results.brief_description: An Open Learning University video course in Economics. This series examines some of the questions concerning contemporary students of Economics and International Relations. Each episode incorporates a round-table panel discussion by international economists who discuss the issues and themes introduced.

results.title: The Glass house
results.creator_credit: Rick Rosenberg, Robert W. Christiansen, Tomorrow Entertainment and Tom Gries
results.brief_description: Adapted for television from a short story by Truman Capote and Wyatt Cooper, “The Glass house” gives an inside view of prison life and the prison system in one of America’s toughest prisons and is filmed entirely on location at Utah State Prison. Although the story and characters are completely fictitious, the situations are based on real-life experiences with most of the background faces and voices being those of actual prisoners. The story begins with several new inmates, including a college professor, Jonathan Paige (Alan Alda) and a rather young and naive teenager, Allan Campbell (Kristoffer Tabori), going through the processes of prison induction. However it is not long before Paige and Campbell are approached by the rather brutal and sadistic gang boss in the prison, Hugo Slocum (Vic Morrow) and each has to make his own choice as to which road he will take. Violence, corruption, drugs, rape and intimidation are all part of the prison “game”, even to the point where the prison guards and the warden can be paid by the gang leaders to turn a blind eye to attacks on individual prisoners. Only the new prison guard (Clu Gulager), full of ideals and good intentions can provide any hope to this corrupt and brutal system. “The Glass house” is a grim reminder of the psychological and physical abuse which takes place inside prisons and to director Tom Gries’ credit, the film is presented in a realistic style, containing some violence necessary to the story, but not glorified or over-the-top as in some of the action movies of today. (Awards: Nominated Best Movie Made for TV in the 1973 Golden Globe Awards; San Sebastian International Film Festival) Cast also includes Dean Jagger and Billy Dee Williams.

results.title: The Girls and daddy
results.creator_credit: American Mutoscope and Biograph Company and D.W. Griffith
results.brief_description: Melodrama by D.W. Griffith about two young ladies and a burglar. The film is presented in two parts: first, the scenes in the order in which they were photographed, and then as edited. The first part is silent, and the second has a musical accompaniment. Cast includes David Miles, Florence Lawrence, Dorothy West, Mack Sennett.

results.title: The Girl from Tomorrow. Ep 7-9
results.creator_credit: Noel Price, Film Australia, Nine Network and Kathy Mueller
results.brief_description: Alana, the girl from Year 3000, resigns herself to the fact that she’ll be trapped forever in this barbaric past, where the air is hard to breathe and the technology is extremely primitive. Then she discovers that Silverthorn is alive and that he has got the time machine. A deep and lasting friendship develops between the two girls, as they race against time to recover the time capsule, which has been programmed to return automatically to Alana’s home in just thirty days.

results.title: The Girl from Tomorrow. Ep 4-6
results.creator_credit: Noel Price, Film Australia, Nine Network and Kathy Mueller
results.brief_description: Alana, a lively 13 year old from the Year 3000, was discovered by Jenny and is now living with Jenny’s mum and Jenny’s brother, Petey. She convinces them of the truth of her story. She attends the same school as Jenny, and her strange behaviour in the classroom is making their science teacher James suspicious of her real identity.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Noel Price, Film Australia, Nine Network and Kathy Mueller

results.title: The Girl from Tomorrow. Ep 10-12
results.creator_credit: Noel Price, Film Australia, Nine Network and Kathy Mueller
results.brief_description: Alana, the girl from the year 3000, with the help of Irene, Jenny’s mother, and James, the good-looking science teacher from Jenny’s school, battle the charming but ruthless Silverthorn for control of the time capsule in a series of dramatic adventures which lead to a spectacular climax. Share in the excitement, mystery and adventure of a girl a thousand years from home - the girl from tomorrow.

results.title: The Girl and her trust
results.brief_description: An attempted train robbery by some tramps goes awry when a young telephonist alerts the next station. Features a great train chase. Cast includes Dorothy Bernard, Wilfred Lucas, Edwin August, Charles Gorman, Walter Long. Silent film with English intertitles.
results.description: An attempted train robbery by some tramps goes awry when a young telephonist alerts the next station. Features a great train chase. Cast includes Dorothy Bernard, Wilfred Lucas, Edwin August, Charles Gorman, Walter Long. Silent film with English intertitles.

results.title: The Gifted ones. - Rev. ed.
results.creator_credit: David Bairstow, ONF | NFB and Don Haldane
results.brief_description: The gifted child, whose advanced mind distinguishes him from others of his age, is a valuable asset to society. Some say gifted children should be taught in a class of their own. Others say that the average classroom is better for them. The film presents the views of two prominent educators: Dr Florence Dunlop, Ottawa, and Dr. T.W. Martin, Toronto.
